website_summaries.verdict: A solid, slightly better-than-basic dSLR, the Canon EOS Rebel T1i delivers photo quality and performance that adequately compensates for most of its annoyances.
cons: video capture is its only better-than-basic feature

customer_reviews.title: Canon T1i fits what I wanted, perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: Came in real good condition as advertised. Battery and memory storage was inserted and ready. I've been having a great time getting acquainted with my T1i. Great results of local outdoor scenery. High resolution. I shoot RAW, then go right to editing with my software. Much fun and getting real good results that please me. Camera does a super job on auto. Then I branch out and do some manual setting. Just ordered tripod and remote shutter release cable to reduce shake on slower shutter speeds. The 3 attached photos have different degrees of photo editing to brighten.
customer_reviews.author: Salgood

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: We bought this camera a while back, and it is still serving us faithfully. I'm the photo nerd of the family, and am perfectly satisfied with the adjustments available in manual. My wife favors the point-and-shoot, and it fits her needs well in that respect. My one complaint: the "auto" settings tend towards the bright, and we often end up with photos that are washed out with light, or are blurry for having a longer exposure time. It's nothing that can't be adjusted, but it is a little irritating to have to adjust the brightness settings every time the camera is turned on in "auto".
customer_reviews.author: Josh carlson

customer_reviews.title: Canon Rebel Will Not Disappoint
customer_reviews.text: The Canon Rebel is a great camera. We have been using Canon Cameras for years. Our first Canon Rebel we bought 10 years ago. The camera still worked great but decided to upgrade and we love the new Canon Rebel. Picture quality is very clear for inside and outdoor shots. We are very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Family

customer_reviews.title: i truly do like it but it's been a little difficult to find ...
customer_reviews.text: i truly do like it but it's been a little difficult to find accessories because of the year the model came out. It seems like a T2i (or T3i) would have been a smarter choice but so far I've been able to do what I've wanted. I was disappointed in the kit. It seemed to lack basic needs like a USB cord, but I was able to use a cord from an old GPS system I no longer use.
customer_reviews.author: Maverick In Philly

customer_reviews.title: well priced very good used camera
customer_reviews.text: The camera looks like new and, so far, works like new. It's perfect for when I want to take pictures out on the water, kayaking, where the camera is at risk. Not a huge financial loss if something happens to the camera. Also purchased an inexpensive used 55-250 zoom lens for it. Ready to take great pictures out in the wild.
customer_reviews.author: Kickerville Clem

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't compare to the new cameras
customer_reviews.text: For it's time it was great but it's not worth it to buy this camera in this day and age. You can just buy something else for the same price that is way better, or you can spend one or two hundred more and get a way better camera.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great deal
customer_reviews.text: lets be honest the battery and charger were not original and the body lens cover and manual was not included. that said, the price was a steal and the camera works great. i got the body lens cover for 5 bucks and the manual is online at the canon website , the battery and charger it came with work just fine. It's a really good camera canon always has made me happy with their products and i can't believe what a good price I got
customer_reviews.author: eduardo a atha

customer_reviews.title: ho hum
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived with a broken filter...which the glass got into the lens...so now the lens is messed up...tried to contact seller and they have yet to respond....so i am buying a new lens...But the camera quality is first rate
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Doherty

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional camera for a good price
customer_reviews.text: Listed as Very Good and still exceeds my expectations. I can't find any signs of use and it looks and functions like brand new. I will be using it with a telescope and filter to shoot the eclipse, but plan to use it for full-frame pictures of the moon, the Andromeda galaxy, and the Pleiades.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M. Walton

customer_reviews.title: It was used but like new. Well
customer_reviews.text: I have used an old canon rebel 35mm for years. I finally opted to find this T1i. It was used but like new. Well, it was like getting a new camera. Everything was packed like it was new, except the packaging was carefully opened. I have purchas many things from Amazon over the years and received one damaged item, which they sent another and sent a return for the damaged item. I am very happy with this camera. It isn't the latest and greatest, but taking great pics is more about the photographer and the glass and less about the camera...to a point. You can get great results out of this camera////
customer_reviews.author: Douglas M. Market

customer_reviews.title: It seems fully functional. Small missing rubber trim around optical viewfinder
customer_reviews.text: It seems fully functional. Small missing rubber trim around optical viewfinder. doesnt affect operation though. got adapters and SD card and USB cable and seems to work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Newman

customer_reviews.title: It's great - I bought a second one
customer_reviews.text: This is my second digital rebel. I've been using one for two years; this one is for my wife. They have only improved it. It has enough capability to satisfy 99 per cent of the photographers out there. It's light as a feather, and its feature set makes it nearly infinitely adjustable, from full manual to full auto focus/exposure. I originally selected and stayed with Canon because there was an adapter available use my Leica lenses on it. I can't say that Canon has any edge on its competitors.
customer_reviews.author: Gary L. Misch

customer_reviews.title: I like the t1 and 2. I’ll stick with these until they’re obsolete.
customer_reviews.text: Came fast, beautifully packaged. Very creative (was that a doggie pee pad or a person one? Either way, very soft and protective.
customer_reviews.author: Asher

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: The Canon Rebel T1i was my first foray into the world of DSLRs. I took it on several hikes and the picture quality is amazing. I'm still learning all the different features instead of just using the basic point and shoot feature, so if the pictures don't look that good, I doubt it's because of the camera! My camera is made in Taiwan - I remember reading that others' were made in Japan. Anyway, Taiwan is known for making top quality cameras and I haven't had any problems with it. Great compact camera that is easy enough for a newbie to use, and yet packed with enough features to even keep my more-experienced photographer friends pleased.
customer_reviews.author: My two cents

customer_reviews.title: love this dslr
customer_reviews.text: This is my first dslr. I was concerned about being able to learn to use the many capabilities but I have been very pleased with the ease of learning to use the many features. It's also easy to set to aim and shoot for quick pics. The timer option works great and I love the option of how many auto to take. This is a better lens than I expected and the image stabalization is an awesome feature! I'm very pleased with picture quality. I look forward to adding a macro lens and telephoto lenses to have more fun with this Canon! I'm extremely pleased with this purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Carol M

customer_reviews.title: 18 months later, still very happy
customer_reviews.text: I don't want to repeat what everyone else said, and if you want a review of specifics, there are several great sites out there that will provide a good analysis for you. However, what I can say, is that 18 months and 7,500 pictures later, I am very happy with this camera. I upgraded the kit lens to the 17-55mm 2.8 IS, and am very impressed with the results. I typically always want to upgrade whatever I have, but this is the first time where I feel I am content with the picture quality. There are better cameras out there, but for the money though, this camera does the job well.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Very good camera
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a starter camera for my teenaged daughter. Works very well and is easy to use and learn on.
customer_reviews.author: Meagan H.

customer_reviews.title: 30,000 images, and still loving it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Canon T1i in May, 2009. Thirty thousand images later, the camera is still going strong. I have the original kit lens, and sometimes put an extension tube on it for use in obtaining closeups of flowers and insects. Currently I have the camera paired with the Canon 70-200 L f4 IS USM lens, and 1.4x teleconverter, and I am extremely pleased with my image quality. I am considering the purchase of a Canon 7D camera, with the new enhanced focus abilities, but will certainly continue to carry this camera in the field for a long time to come.
customer_reviews.author: C. Seaton

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I had my camera for a month now, and I love it! I am still learning everything! If you are new, don't get overwhelmed. It's great! IF you are a professonial or advanced, you properly have something more exspensive, but I love it! Nov. 30, 2010---- Still love my camera! I have 4 lenses and cant wait until I can afford the wide ultra lens! I love my camera. I have taken pictures at sporting events such as soccer, hockey, and baseball. (looks like you are right next to them) pictures of kids running, prom, and families! It's great for whatever you do! UPDATE: Feb. 28, 2012~ Still love my camera!! I love my ultra wides lens!! Great camera!
customer_reviews.author: T. K. Mccullouth

customer_reviews.title: Used it for a few years, like the compact size with decent features
customer_reviews.text: Camera body has to be compact, light, and with adequate features. You should spend $$ on decent lens. Ok, this camera doesn't have an LCD setting display, you'll have to use the screen, it doesn't have image review big zoom-in to check if the photo is sharp (you'll have to press + several times), no customizeable quick function button (like bracketting), but everything else is good enough for my needs. At the end, I like the customizeable contrast setting, AP and P modes, good lasting battery and compact size. When I need to upgrade camera, will probably do something similar: not the high end camera body. Skip the kit lens, they are terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto F

customer_reviews.title: Fond Memories
customer_reviews.text: I am truly enjoying the EOS T1i. The picture quality is great, as expected. For ease of use, it reminds me of my favorite old film camera, the A-1, which I used extensively. The controls are intuitive, and I really glad I sprung for the BG-E5 battery grip. It makes portrait format pictures much easier with the shutter button in the "right" place. Over the years, I had a couple of FTb's, an A-1, and an F-l, and recently a T-1i Rebel; all film cameras. Alas, that day is gone. This camera almost makes me welcome the digital age.
customer_reviews.author: Karl F. Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Great camera and great price
customer_reviews.text: Just received my camera from Amazon. I bought body only for $609 and received it in 3days. included but i don't think mention is a brand new battery, i thought i would only get a charger. I have own the canon rebel 300d, 350d and 450d and this i promise will be the last camera i'll buy unless they make a 3-d camera with a tilt view finder. I love the higher iso that i can get that i couldn't get with the canon xsi. The first thing i did with the canon T1i was adjust the sharpness level after reading many reviews that the photos was a bit on the soft side.
customer_reviews.author: robert ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great first SLR
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera. It doesn't have all of the bells and whistles of a 5D or a 1D, but it gets the job done and takes great pictures. Before buying the T1i I compared it with the T2i, and the 50D, both of which are quite a bit more expensive. I felt like I was "settling" for the T1i, and I was worried that I would wish that I had bought a more expensive body. I don't regret my decision at all, though. I have no complaints about the T1i - it has been wonderful. Unless you are a professional photographer I see no reason to get anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Foote

customer_reviews.title: On this category, best value
customer_reviews.text: The camera has a great grip and weight, nice battery duration, and make terrific pictures.. You get good colors and quality using the correct settings. Menu is not so easy to use (if u are not familiar with canon), but after few days, u get it! It's simply amazing to do HD videos with it. Great stuff for short movies. Only things to worry about this: not to cover the mic on the left, in the front face; and setting the focus - thats painful to get used. And unfortunately, its not possible to do 24fps videos or to change ISO or speed.
customer_reviews.author: CID Monteiro

customer_reviews.title: This camara rocks!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this about 7 years ago, when the T1i was hot stuff. I LOVE the pictures I have taken from this. My photographer daughter who is now 19 LOVEs this camara with the macro lens. In fact, she confiscated it. I only get it once in awhile, when I can track her down. Still working. No issues. No problems. I love the everyday lense it came with. Works for me. In fact, we just bought the Rebel T5i, so MOM can now have a camara of her own.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 5

customer_reviews.title: if you want photography-like photos...
customer_reviews.text: This canon rebel is a good starter package. basically for people who want to upgrade from a smaller megapixel. This was a recnt bday gift from my boyfriend. he knew i love taking pictures. so he asked which camera i wanted. i went with this after deciding which one i wanted. I love my rebel! Perfect time because its fall time and all the changing leaves make a perfect candidate for taking photos. Soon after i learn more i will upgrade to a more expensive rebel.
customer_reviews.author: NorthernCatt

customer_reviews.title: Great investment
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my college photography class years ago. It was great for someone who was starting up in photography. I still have the camera. Though I wish I purchase the t2i at the time instead due to the screen flipping in and out. But overall it was a great investment.
customer_reviews.author: Musicman

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal..
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure there are plenty of other in-depth reviews to look through so I'll keep this simple. This camera is amazing. It is my first DSLR but comparing it to my best friends D3100 it is much better in quite a few ways. If you are just getting started I would recommend this camera to you. The only thing that is lacking in my opinion is the video. Its a pain in the arse to focus it at first but you get used to it. Also It only shoots 20fps in full HD so you will notice a lackluster video. Otherwise, go for it. Get this camera. (its easy on the wallet too!)
customer_reviews.author: Justin A. Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Awesome DSLR - my first
customer_reviews.text: I now use a 50D for last 3 years since I sold this Rebel, but more than many times have thought the XSi was sharper with the 18-55 mm kit lens than 50D with 18-135 IS lens I am using now. The kit lens was made in Japan (not Thailand as mostly the case is). The buyer on Craigs was offered full retail just because he wanted the Japan made lens. I miss it now...The T1i was my second purchase and very similar to 50D, so my comments are similar.
customer_reviews.author: Dealzguy

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: This was my first SLR camera and I think it was a great choice. I have taken so many pictures that turn out so much better than my other point-n-shoots cameras. The image quality is awsome and has so many features, still trying to learn them all. Even tried the video feature over the 4th of July and it works pretty good. Probably better than my smaller flip flash drive camera. Received the discount for the additional zoom lens making this a great deal. That was the reason I bought it from Amazon. I would buy this camera again, and recommend it to people getting into SLR photography.
customer_reviews.author: hardwater

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first SLR after owning/using a few Canon point-and-shoot cameras. I love it! The HD video is a great feature and it's a great camera for an amateur photog like me who just wants to get the best quality shots possible and have room to grow. I plan on having this camera and enjoying its wonderful features and beautiful photos and video for many years to come. Great investment if your photos really matter to you (i.e. your kids, your pets, special occasions, vacations, etc.) You won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: 2dogmom

customer_reviews.title: Third Canon DSLR
customer_reviews.text: I needed a smaller camera body for my kayak trip to Costa Rica as my D bodies are too large. The T1i takes all of my lenses,which are fairly large and gives me much smaller package.I have taken about 100 shots so far just to check out the various modes and so far so good. I have not been that impressed with the picture quality thus far with many shot a little over exposed. This was in comparison with my D20 and D40. I will be in a much better position to comment after I return from from my trip. Jay D
customer_reviews.author: E. J. Deangeli

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is great - it take wonderful pictures. Easy to use and the price was right. You get a good lens with purchase. The HD videos are nice but they do come through rather large. But I am still learning on if and how I can size them down. This camera is also great if you have active children. My 3 year old is very active and always on the go. Now that I have this camera she is not a blurr. And I have some great action shots.
customer_reviews.author: S. Matte

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera
customer_reviews.text: You do not have to be a professional to use this camera. I have taken excellent pictures in the auto mode! I will use the other settings as I learn more about the camera. I have been very pleased taking pictures in low light settings using the auto mode. I previously bought the Nikon P90 and sent it back because I could not take a decent picture indoors. All the pictures were blurry or orange. The Canon is the better camera hands down in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: April D. Lamontagne

customer_reviews.title: Cannot say enough good things about this camera
customer_reviews.text: Cannot say enough good things about this camera. I have created some of the best photos with this. I have had for 2 years and over 38,000 shutter accuations and it performs as well now as it did the first day I got it. You cannot go wrong with this model. HIGHLY, HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!! Thanks Canon for many, many, many hours of enjoyment!!
customer_reviews.author: Steven W. Shackelford

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for the price
customer_reviews.text: The only two things I can think of that is not ideal on this camera is as follows: 1) They don't include an hdmi cable in the box, which would be really helpful and convenient. 2) It was weird that the record button for the video is not the shutter button. I kept pressing it and realized it was not recording. Other than those, I am enjoying this camera a lot! It takes wonderful pictures and the size is perfect to bring around.
customer_reviews.author: Ornojo

customer_reviews.title: Canon T1i
customer_reviews.text: Torn between this entry DSLR and the equivalent Nikon. Decided on this for the auto LCD shut-off, the slightly better pixel count. The rap on this camera is the noise factor after ISO 400. This is the rap on every camera. The pictures I have taken up to ISO 1200 are usable (with a little help from Photoshop. All and all a good DSLR. I am happy with purchase. Would recommend getting another battery and the Canon battery grip which offers an alternative placement on the shutter button.
customer_reviews.author: J. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for two photo shoots
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for two photo shoots, then one day the shutter starts sticking....no matter what setting I use. I get a half dark frames. Trying to get it repaired would not be what I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: Flip

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: I'm a novice in photography, bought this camera for my trip to NYC and it served it purpose really really well. I really appreciate the owner took extra time to leave a note in the package if we need further help with the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for several months now and absolutely love it. The battery stays charged for a very long time, even in cold weather. The pictures are crisp, and if you are learning how to use a DSLR it is a great starter camera. The lens that comes with it isn't the best by any means, but it was great for starting out and I haven't had a problem out of the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: ask questions before buying
customer_reviews.text: The camera is just as described except the lens they shipped with it is a non-IS lens (VERY OLD MODEL) it is 18-55 1:3.5-5.6 II model. also is NOT T1i but D500 (i know, same camera specs) but lets call it what it is shall we? I'll probably re-sell the lens since I don't need it. I wanted the camera. Don't bye from them. The camera is good but get genuin batteries not the chinese ones.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Ratajczak

customer_reviews.title: Canon Digital Rebel T1i
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a replacement for my Rebel DS6041 mostly because I wanted more speed in the multiple exposure mode, and compatibility with the lenses I already own. The T1i delivers that and a larger viewing screen that includes the menus for setup, etc. A BIG improvement! Also added features I won't be using. If (or when) I want a movie camera, it won't be an SLR. That minor gripe aside, I recommend this camera
customer_reviews.author: 64ragtop

customer_reviews.title: Efficient
customer_reviews.text: This Camera did great for me except the fact that the battery only last a couple weeks. Now the battery will not take a charge. No worries it is an easy fix and everything else about the camera is great, and quite simple.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Love the SD Card, and Canon in general
customer_reviews.text: I have the old Rebel XTi, and this is a great upgrade to that model. I don't need video capability, but this has improved functionality, and is easy to use (if your'e familiar with Canon). It also fits all of my older lenses, and allows me to use the SD card instead of the Compact Flash (XTi).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very comprhensive camera
customer_reviews.text: I have really enjoyed using my Canon Rebel T1i. I was able to get it through Amazon at what I thought was a really good price, with lens attached! The quality is great and so are the photos. The only thing I don't like is that with most the settings I have to look through the view finder instead of the window. Or maybe I just don't have it all figured out yet. But my son says my photos are two to three hundred times better, so that counts for something!
customer_reviews.author: Gloria M. Bain

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful camera
customer_reviews.text: I'm still working on learning all the features but even just with the fully automatic is is great. Any SLR takes some time to learn but I can't fault the quality of the pictures. Auto focus is the only thing I'm not totally pleaed with because it will get confused at times and start going back and forth so you loose the shot or switch to manual and the ring is a bit small for accurate focusing.
customer_reviews.author: Joan S.

customer_reviews.title: Happy Novice
customer_reviews.text: As a guy who knows extremely little about photography, Im really happy with my purchase. Set to fully automatic, this thing is taking pro like photos right out of the box. I purchased the "T1i for Dummies" book and after three days feel super confident surfing through most of the features this camera has. If you are a novice like me and want to take professional quality photos, this camera is a great choice even if you dont venture away from full auto. I would suggest the "For Dummies" series if you want to get a step by step tour through all of the cameras features and capabilities. Taking more creative shots is made easy with the camera/ book combo.
customer_reviews.author: M. Rohlfing

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great camera body for hobbyist! It's not so big that I feel like I'm lugging around at Tank, but its substantial enough to feel good in the hand. I know I'll have to upgrade a some point, but this camera has plenty of features and benefits tat I can learn on now.
customer_reviews.author: Kate H

customer_reviews.title: A great upgrade from my Rebel XT.
customer_reviews.text: I am really happy with my purchase. Better resolution, better image quality, beautiful and bright hi res LCD, live view, HD video, etc. I was partly attracted to the T1i b/c of it's HD video capability. I read some negatives regarding it such as poor 1080p video and poor sound quality due to the stock mic. I did not intend on getting this to replace my camcorder so it has been just fine at 720p for quick clips in between pictures. At the recommendation of another reviewer, I bought the SanDisk Extreme III SDHC from the start and haven't had any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Gadgetlover

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. It does what it supposed to for a prosumer model. I've taken high speed snaps as well as video. You have to have a memory card that is fast enough. I've tried several different one until I landed on the SanDisk Extreme 32 GB SDHC Class 10 UHS-1
customer_reviews.author: AmazonBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal Camera
customer_reviews.text: When buying this camera, this was the best camera for it's price, as compared to the newer Canon Rebel series. Compared to the T2, T3, and T4i series cameras, this is a bare-minimum SLR that doesn't feature all the other features that those did. It offers a great 15.1 MP picture. I have had no problems with this for the year that I have had it. A great beginners camera when stepping up from a point-and-shoot to a DLSR.
customer_reviews.author: JasonB

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is exceptional for the features. My wife and I were looking to upgrade to a digital SLR and have been amazed at the difference from our old point and shoot. There are many features on this camera but you can still set it on full auto for those who don't wish to understand all the options. This has been a great camera and you can't beat the price for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: RowdyRout

customer_reviews.title: A great investment
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased a number of cameras - all fell short is some area - this has it all great picture quality and features. The best is that it is quick enough to catch our grand kids in motion and it has HD video as a plus. I started with a 35mm EOS when our kids were young - best investment at that time - the T1i is the camera you should 'focus' on now.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality For The Price
customer_reviews.text: I have owned a EOS Rebel for six years and was pleased with it except when using with the Canon flash. This camera is a big step above the old one. It has greater low light capabilities and works well with the Canon flash. I haven't had occasion to use the video capabilities of it yet. The PC/Camera interface works very well. Overall, I am very pleased with the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Richard H. Sweet

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for students.
customer_reviews.text: The camera works great, but takes a little getting used to. Prime example: I couldn't manually focus; for reasons I could not grasp it kept changing on me until I was able to find the automatic focus setting and turn it off. Great variable shutter speed, perfect for learning with a great price and takes unbelievably great pics. Would recommend, would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth S.

customer_reviews.title: it was pretty good but came with a little scratch in the ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought it 2nd hand, it was pretty good but came with a little scratch in the screen (that i would like the seller have told me about in the description), seems to be working fine, I also would have really like for it to come with the strap, but finding one of those is way easier and cheaper than the camera hahaha si wont get very picky, thank you very much!
customer_reviews.author: Alejandra

customer_reviews.title: Memory card came apart in the camera.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a friend. He had a memory card come apart. We had a photographer get the pieces out, but it will no longer read any card. what to do?
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Jennings

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is awesome. Took it out of the box, loaded my card and bam...taking great pictures. The clarity is incredible. Right now I am taking everything with the autofocus which works great. I can't wait to see what cool stuff I can do when I learn to manually do somethings. One thing that I did play with is the shutter speed...I took a picture of my floor fan that was running at high speed. The picture clearly showed the fan blades (no blur nothing). The picture made it appear that I took a picture of the fan when it was off. How cool is that?
customer_reviews.author: AlabasterSong

customer_reviews.title: The best camera for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect camera for my needs. Shipped fast and was in excellent condition.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: excellent camera!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am not a pro but I wanted to get a high end DSLR which would help take excellent photos at night. This camera serves that purpose and much more. It is a bit pricy for a beginners DSLR, but if you have the money go for it. I also read reviews elsewhere that canon's cameras do a better job at capturing colors vs Nikon. That was another reason to go with canon instead of Nikon.
customer_reviews.author: Sainath Kesavan

customer_reviews.title: Love my first "grown up" camera!
customer_reviews.text: Love love love my camera. Bought refurbished and it is like new. Wonderful condition. Pictures are beautiful! Just as described. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: BooKCrazyKindleGirl

customer_reviews.title: Very Good camera when I use it.
customer_reviews.text: I'm still learning the neat stuff I can do with this camera even after 4 years of owning it. My Photos are coming out very well, and it takes the photos very quickly. It has a quick turn on time for an old digital camera, and the battery life or power consumption is great. It just keeps taking photos in the dark and light.
customer_reviews.author: gregbgh

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived on time but not as expected. The auto-focus would not work properly, although the camera body itself was in good shape.
customer_reviews.author: Casey W. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera - worth the $
customer_reviews.text: Great Camera! Canon has really packed a lot of capability in a small package. Picture quality is great, easy to use, great 3.0" LCD display and fits great in your hands. Video is Good but NOT a primary video camera. The focus/zoom feature is very weak, the T2i would be much better. For the price, totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Medina

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic camera!
customer_reviews.text: The camera is super fast to focus and responds immediately to commands. It takes incredibly detailed photographs, too! Much better than any average point and shoot camera.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Zicari

customer_reviews.title: Best camera ever!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several digital point and shoots. I was sick of missing shots while waiting for it to focus etc. So I took the plunge and bought a "real" camera. This things is fast! I can finally get true candid shots of my kids and pets...the colors are vivid and the settings are easy to learn...even for me!
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Lampton

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I love my camera. Plain and simple. I was set on the T2i but then i realized there isnt a big enough difference between the T2i and the T1i for me to spend 200 more bucks on the T2i, so i went with the T1i. It does great still photography even with crappy lighting and although its overwhelming with all the buttons, just relax and read the book on the parts you dont get and once you try it out it makes you love the camera even more. The flash is weird because it flashes AS it is focusing so peoples eyes start to hurt but other than that its pretty dang awesome.
customer_reviews.author: CaptainKfed

customer_reviews.title: This SLR is the way to go a great entry level camera for family photos
customer_reviews.text: takes thoughs professional pics that we were looking for, no need to go to a Sears or Walmart for pics, just set a back brop and take your own. This SLR is the way to go a great entry level camera for family photos.
customer_reviews.author: Larnell

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic camera.
customer_reviews.text: I've had a 5D for a little while now. Love it. My wife liked it's performance but wanted something simpler. I got her a Canon Powershot - took great pics and video but it was still too slow. The Rebel T1i was everything she wanted - fast, great quality pics and videos, and simple to use. And reasonably priced too.
customer_reviews.author: Chubbs00

customer_reviews.title: Works like a dream
customer_reviews.text: This is literally exactly what I wanted. I was a point and shoot kinda person, but i realized it was time to amp it up a notch. Never did I think a camera that could take such crystal clear shots and offer so much could also be so user friendly. With a great price, an incredibly HD video camera, superb focus and incredibly crisp photos, this is by far one of the best machines of its kind. I recommend this camera to everyone looking for a device that not only works like a dream, but also enables you to change and alter a lot within your own comfort zone of skill and experience. Fantastic, just fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Konmaz

customer_reviews.title: T1i- Benchmark for better photographs
customer_reviews.text: This is a brilliant camera. I am extremely happy as its quality is par with Nikon D-90 and canon D-50. The sensor is APSC and though gapless microlenses are not there it is good enough for all practical purposes (photo and HD video at 30 fps 720p and 20 fps 1080p). Though T2i is the elder brother T1i is the first in its class. I am extremely satisfied and will not buy a DSLR unless I lose this or damage it. Being a professional, I take nature pics, portraits and architecture. T1i has exceeded my expectations. Service from Amazon and Amazon marketplace (despite its pedigree and poor image) was great.
customer_reviews.author: Nishant Bhushan

customer_reviews.title: "Greatness" is only a click away.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera so I could take my own pictures and use them for my graphic art projects. This camera is awesome all the way around. It is pricy, but it is worth every penny. I asked my friend who is a semi-pro photographer what he recommended for a "starter camera" and this is that, and THEN some. The quality of pictures is absolutely stunning. I do recommend reading the manual before using it though because it has so many buttons and numbers that are not on your everyday camera. Once you get past those things, you're golden.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Decent Camera for the Price
customer_reviews.text: For those of us who like having nice stuff but don't need the top professional grade equipment, this is the right camera for you. I have had if for about two years and have never had a problem with it. It takes great photos and works with an array of lenses.
customer_reviews.author: JMB

customer_reviews.title: Good camera, bad lense
customer_reviews.text: Camera was good but the lense was actually broken. While you could still manually focus it was much worse than"sticking" as the description read. Still a decent buy and the camera itself was good.
customer_reviews.author: Sam B

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Pro/Am Camera
customer_reviews.text: I love the features and customization. This replaced my Canon 35mm SLR bought 12 years ago, and like the rest of the world, I can't believe that anyone ever used film! Picture quality is excellent, focus and frame rate fast, design and screen are easy to use. Do not be lured by the HD video option. This will not replace a good video recorder. The system will not focus automatically, and the motors & drives make such a racket that any sound in the video is lost. If you want a great DSLR this is the best for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice product..using it for 2 year.. no single issue... Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Abir

customer_reviews.title: Loving My DSLR
customer_reviews.text: I've finally made the leap from my point-n-shoot to the DSLR world - and I'm loving it! First of all, the picture clarity is fantastic! Worlds apart from the old camera. The lighting that this camera gets in low light situations is dramatic! No real need for me to adjust pictures to be "lighter"... I still have a long way to go in learning all of the tricks and techniques that this model has to offer. I have tried the video feature and it is also top notch as well. Very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Steven Reiss

customer_reviews.title: A Picture!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is great. I am a beginner and this camera is loaded with options.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Takes amazing pictures. My mother always borrows it...would be a nice birthday gift! The price was great.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Q

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is incredible! I'm an amateur photographer and this is a perfect fit for my needs. 18-55mm is a great lens but i think soon I will need a better lens since my daughter will be walking/running within the next year. My hands are a little on the shaky side and needed the stabilizer function. I have so much to learn still but if you are an amateur photographer looking to upgrade from a regular ol' digital camera I recommend investing your money in this camera!
customer_reviews.author: Mama2NikkiBelle

customer_reviews.title: Love my new camera
customer_reviews.text: Love my new camera. I only brought the boday and went with a different lens. Which I'm so happy I did. The camera was brought used and works great. I have no issues with it and I can't wait to starting learning.
customer_reviews.author: Christin

customer_reviews.title: Great quality pictures
customer_reviews.text: This is my first DSLR camera, and it is a joy to use. I find I am taking more pictures then I ever did with my old point and shoot. It has the preset settings like a point and shoot, however the manual functions give me more options while shooting in low light that I could not acheive with the auto functions. I ordered the camera on a Monday and received it on Friday. Very pleased the the fast shipping. I would recommend getting a telephoto lense. The 18-55 lense that came with the kit is Ok at best. Also I would recommend getting a tripod if your planning on using a telephoto or macro lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Norman J. Papp

customer_reviews.title: Works quite well!
customer_reviews.text: Been a long time since bought this... still working great
customer_reviews.author: Trent Young

customer_reviews.title: Great camera/lens combo
customer_reviews.text: Got this camera with the EF 55-300mm lens bundle as a present for my wife. She reviewed the specs before I made the purchase, so it wasn't exactly a surprise. But, she was definitely surprised at the quality and usefulness of the camera. She takes many pics of birds and other wild life, so is getting lots of use from the 55-300mm lens. A few days after the camera arrived, she saw the same camera, but with a lesser lens bundle, for more money at our local Costco. I was impressed with the very speedy and free delivery. Note I left some categories un-rated as we have yet to use those features.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Neighbors

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera.
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, I enjoy taking photos with it. Still working properly a great Camera for a Beginner. Update 12/12/17.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: If you are new to SLRs or even new to photography this is a great camera to get. I can't speak of more expensive cameras but the quality of this camera is so good that I am very happy with it and I would suggest it to anyone. The fact that the video doesn't auto focus can get annoying but this is a camera after all. If you want a reliable, high quality camera for a resonable price, get this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Keyth

customer_reviews.title: Great price for this little camera
customer_reviews.text: My son is learning photography in high school, he doing really well! These are some of his images,makes with this camera. Great price for this little camera. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Moon

customer_reviews.title: Very good first DSLR!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in late 2009 as a gift for the SO who had requested "a camera that would do HD video too". She uses it for snapshots (it is that easy to use)and short video and I use it for astrophotography, project documentation, and general photography. The video quality in full 1080p is slow at 20fps, as others mention. Also it eats Kingston SD's for lunch. I had it trash a brand new 16GB SD so bad it was worthless afterward... Could have just been a bad card, but others note the poor performance of Kingston SD in this camera too. Stick with the SanDisk SD and it is good.
customer_reviews.author: James Harris

customer_reviews.title: More Than Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I have had for 3 months and have used a great deal-- it is now almost like an old friend that I enjoy revisiting each time. I wanted primarily to move up to a camera with really good low-light performance and I have been more than satisfied. Though I still prefer not to use flash, I was also surprised by the much more natural results compared to cheaper cameras. The accessibility of the camera's features is also very impressive. And so on with all the features of this camera that are well documents in these reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Oxman

customer_reviews.title: EXCEEDED MY EXPECTATIONS
customer_reviews.text: This camera has all the features needed to produce professional results. I upgraded from an inexpensive point and shoot camera to the T1i, and the manual and software that came with the camera made the transition easy. Canon's website is loaded with helpful information to make taking photos FUN.
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful camera for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful camera for beginners. I use it for both stills and video, and I have to say, it does have some limitations when it comes to video, but I'm able to work around them.
customer_reviews.author: penname

customer_reviews.title: My first DSLR, love it
customer_reviews.text: I used to use point-and-shoot cameras, produced many pictures which most time looks plain. My friend recommanded this one to me. Still learning, but overall very happy with it. Love a lot features. Highly recommanded for beginners like me.
customer_reviews.author: James Ford

customer_reviews.title: Wow, love it
customer_reviews.text: As the title states i love this camera, i'm a newbie when it comes to cameras but i've always bought low end and never really liked the results. Every picture is crystal clear while just in auto mode and with accessories and bag everything was still under a grand, just gonna say you get what you pay for and this camera is worth every penny. I would recommend it to any family member or friend without regret. Thanks again amazon
customer_reviews.author: Idaho113

customer_reviews.title: it doen not work so good. Maybe Sony is better brand
customer_reviews.text: My friend send the coupon on dealsea to me, the I purchased. More than 6 years, it doen not work so good. Maybe Sony is better brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Angela

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned two Canon's and loved them both. A friend encouraged us to purchase another manufacturer's digital camera. What a big mistake. I was so disappointed with it. I decided to spend the extra money and get us a Canon SLR Digital, best decision I ever made. Canon has always made a quality camera. They have made changing lenses a piece of cake, battery life is excellent, the 3" display is great. I can't say enough good things about this camera! It will not disappoint!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: awesome camera - fell in love the first time I used it. Easy to use, fantastic pictures!
customer_reviews.author: Angelica Kate (Angela Naff)

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Camera
customer_reviews.text: I use to think that picture quality from subcompact camera are good enough and never understood why people would carry a bulk DSLR camera. However, the picture quality is just unbelievable! I don't understand all the different buttons and settings yet, but the pictures I have taken with the Canon Rebel T1i have been absolutely amazing! If you have kids or if you are using a camera to capture special moments, then for a few hundred dollars more, you'll get something that you can really treasure forever!
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Dad

customer_reviews.title: great seller. item as described
customer_reviews.text: great seller.item as described.i don't know lif before getting this excellent camera and all the joy of taking pictures has given me.the camera was like new no scratches .I would definatly buy from this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: suellen pabon

customer_reviews.title: SWEET
customer_reviews.text: For years I've had the EOSxt and wanted more pixel and a screen in the back that I could frame my pictures from, so when the T1i appeared I just jumped all over it. So far no disappointment. One Love One World.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick A. Rochester

customer_reviews.title: great camera, great deal
customer_reviews.text: We wanted this camera for our daughter. Shopped around and found the lowest price via Amazon. Saved over $100.00 from nearest competitor. Even Walmart's price was $200.00 more. Daughter LOVES the camera and from the pictures I have seen, it takes great pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Rinehart

product_meta.title: Canon EOS Rebel T1i 15.1 MP CMOS Digital SLR Camera with 3-Inch LCD (Body Only)
product_meta.description:
Style:Body Only| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingFROM THE MANUFACTURER


 Canon’s new EOS Rebel T1i is packed with features, both refined and new. In addition to its admirable performance with an all-new 15.1 Megapixel Canon CMOS sensor, DIGIC 4 Image Processor, a 3.0-inch Clear View LCD with anti-reflective and scratch resistant coating, and compatibility with the EOS System of lenses and Speedlites, the EOS Rebel T1i adds remarkable Full HD video capture at resolutions up to 1920 x 1080. 

An HDMI port allows for quick connections to high definition TVs and monitors for easy viewing of your stills and video. The entire operation is simple and easy even if you are a beginner. You’ll have uncompromised EOS Digital performance with power and flexibility right in the palm of your hand. 

EOS Rebel T1i Highlights 

New 15.1-megapixel CMOS sensor with DIGIC 4 Image Processor
Canon’s CMOS (complementary metal oxide semiconductor) sensor captures images with exceptional clarity and tonal range and offers the most pixels in its class. It offers many of the same new technologies as used by Canon’s professional cameras to maximize each pixel’s light gathering efficiency. Its APS-C size sensor creates an effective 1.6x field of view (compared to 35mm format). Canon’s DIGIC 4 Image Processor dramatically speeds up all camera operations for intuitive operation and offers improvements in both fine detail and natural color reproduction. It works in concert with the EOS Rebel T1i’s image sensor to achieve unprecedented levels of performance in all lighting situations. 

14-bit A/D Conversion
With the EOS Rebel T1i, analog to digital signal conversion is executed by a 14-bit processor, which generates digital data with incredibly smooth tones. A feature that originally appeared in top-of-the-line pro digital SLR cameras, the 14-bit conversion gives incredibly smooth transitions from light to dark colors with far less risk of "banding." A sky at sunset is a perfect example. With this rich 14-bit gradation, the EOS Rebel T1i offers RAW images of the highest quality that can be processed with Canon’s Digital Photo Professional software. Even JPEG files, which are always finished at 8-bits per channel, use the full 14-bit conversion initially to generate the best possible color and tonal detail. 

Full HD video capture at 1920 x 1080 resolution
The EOS Rebel T1i shoots brilliant video, even in full high definition. By simply selecting Movie mode on the EOS Rebel T1i’s mode dial, the camera’s 3.0-inch LCD lights up, and it's ready to go. Shooting is at a frame rate of 30 fps when shooting SD or HD quality video (640 x 480 and 1280 x 720 pixels, respectively) and at a frame rate of 20 fps in Full HD (1920 x 1080 pixels) recording. Sound is recorded through the camera’s built-in microphone. Playback modes are simple to access, and all Live View AF features can be used in shooting video. 

Live View Function for stills and video
With Live View Function on the EOS Rebel T1i, you can enjoy nearly every camera function available in normal shooting, all with the convenience of composing on the camera’s brilliant 3.0-inch LCD monitor. You can zoom in and navigate the composition and there’s even a grid overlay for architectural shots. Live View focusing modes include Quick mode, Live mode and Face Detection AF mode and these are easily selectable through the convenient Live View Function menu. 



Wide range ISO setting 100-3200
The EOS Rebel T1i features a greatly expanded ISO range that makes shooting possible in situations previously impossible without flash. With an expanded setting to ISO 3200 (ISO expansion: 6400, 12800), along with the DIGIC 4 Image Processor’s improved noise-reduction technology, your creative possibilities are nearly endless. Combine the EOS Rebel T1i with one of Canon’s EF/EF-S lenses with Optical Image Stabilizer and watch your shooting possibilities expand even further. 

3.0-inch Clear View LCD (920,000 dots/VGA) monitor
The EOS Rebel T1i has a 3.0-inch high resolution LCD monitor that features 920,000 dots/VGA for far more detail than previous Rebel-series LCDs. It’s the same screen found on professional models such as the EOS 5D Mark II. A number of features enhance usability: an anti-reflective and water-repellant coating provides a clearer and more smudge-resistant surface and screen brightness can be adjusted in 7 steps in accordance with ambient light. 

Auto Lighting Optimizer for superior highlight-shadow control
The EOS Rebel T1i’s Auto Lighting Optimizer is yet another image-quality tool that comes to the rescue in tricky lighting conditions. It can actually lighten dark areas of a scene while ensuring that bright areas maintain tonal detail. It’s available in all shooting modes, including P, Tv, Av and Manual. 

Creative Auto goes a step beyond auto allowing control
Especially for beginners looking to expand their photographic horizons, the EOS Rebel T1i offers Creative Auto mode. While basic settings are based on full automatic operation, shooting guides on the LCD screen enable you to make corrections based on simple to follow guidelines. In essence, with Creative Auto mode, you can learn about photography while taking stunning photographs. 



Compatible with over 60 Canon EF/EF-S lenses and most EOS System accessories
EOS Rebel T1i is compatible with all Canon lenses in the EF and EF-S lineup, ranging from ultra-wide angle to super telephoto lenses. Canon lenses employ advanced optical expertise and micron-precision engineering to deliver unprecedented performance in all facets of the photographic process. Special optical technologies, such as Aspherical, ultra-low dispersion, or fluorite elements are featured in the universally acclaimed L-series lenses, and Canon’s Optical Image Stabilizer technology is featured in select lenses, including the EF-S 18-55mm IS lens bundled with the EOS Rebel T1i, to minimize the effect of camera shake. With Canon lenses, you can truly maximize the quality and performance of the EOS camera. 

Flash Photography
The EOS Rebel T1i features Canon’s acclaimed E-TTL II flash metering system. With any EX-series Speedlite, E-TTL II provides reliable flash output whether shooting fill-in flash pictures in sunlight or using flash in total darkness. With E-TTL II, the exact same 35-zone metering sensor used for measuring ambient light is also used for flash metering--giving even finer metering command of the image area. If you prefer a broader area for flash metering, there’s a menu setting to change to "Average" flash metering--where the entire 35-zone area is measured evenly for flash exposure. 
T1i DSLR with optional Speedlite 
Software 

Canon EOS Digital Solution Disk (Version 20)
The EOS Rebel T1i comes bundled with a Canon EOS Digital Solution Disk, which features powerful software programs designed to extend the EOS experience to the computer. These include Canon's EOS Utility (Version 2.6), Digital Photo Professional (Version 3.6), ZoomBrowser EX for Windows (Version 6.3), ImageBrowser for Macintosh OS X (Version 6.3), the Picture Style Editor (Version 1.5), PhotoStitch (version 3.2), WFT Utility (version 3.3). Each application is designed to perfect the captured images and streamline the digital workflow.
Compatible Operating System
Windows: Windows XP SP2 or SP3/ Windows Vista (all version except the Starter Edition)
Macintosh: OS X 10.4 to 10.5 

EOS Utility (Version 2.6) for Macintosh or Windows handles the connection between the camera and computer, whenever they’re connected via USB. It allows remote controlled shooting from the computer, handles downloading of images from the camera to the computer, and allows seamless linking to either Canon’s ZoomBrowser EX/ImageBrowser or Digital Photo Professional software once images have been copied to the hard drive. Furthermore, it’s used to upload settings back into a USB-connected camera. 

Digital Photo Professional (Version 3.6) is an image processing program that enables high-speed RAW image processing, high-speed previewing for real-time image adjustment and support for sRGB, Adobe RGB and Wide Gamut RGB color spaces. Because it’s CMS (Color Management System) compatible, Digital Photo Professional allows for easy image layout and printing in Adobe RGB in conjunction with Easy-PhotoPrint and PictBridge printers. It also features the Dust Delete Data Detection tool for cleaner images. 

Picture Style Editor (Version 1.5) enables you to create custom Picture Style profiles that can be used to customize the appearance of JPEG and RAW images captured with EOS Digital SLR cameras. Picture Style files created with Picture Style Editor can be loaded into the EOS cameras that support Picture Style and may also be used when processing RAW images in Canon software applications Digital Photo Professional, ZoomBrowser EX (for Windows) and ImageBrowser (for Mac). 

ZoomBrowser EX (Version 6.3) for Windows and ImageBrowser (Version 6.3) for Mac OS X are the easy, user-friendly options for viewing and editing of JPEG and even RAW image files. Both allow viewing of numerous types of images including finished TIFF and BMP files. Both also have a variety of search options for finding images, allow re-naming of single images or batches of files, and offer a variety of options for printing without using a separate image-editing program. 



REVIEW FROM DPREVIEW.COM


 

Learn more about this camera
at DPReview.com Canon EOS T1i Digital SLR: Preview by dpreview.com 

Just 14 months after the launch of the EOS Rebel XSi (450D), Canon has unveiled its latest model, the Rebel T1i (500D). It's the fifth generation of Rebel and enters the market at a difficult time - in the midst of a global economic downturn and against the fiercest competition we've ever seen in the entry-level DSLR sector. So what has Canon done to make this latest model in the longest-established family in the sector live up to the edgy and exciting image implied by its US naming? 

The 500D/T1i doesn't quite have to be the everyman camera that its predecessors were. The introduction of the Rebel XS (1000D) in June 2008 means the T1i no longer has to appeal to everybody who doesn't want to stretch to buying into the 50D class. As a result, the 450D was able to bulk up its feature set to include a selection of features that price-conscious shoppers don't necessarily realize they want, such as a larger viewfinder and spot metering. The result was probably the most complete Rebel we'd seen. 

There's a full explanation of the differences between the 500D/T1i and it predecessor on the coming pages but, in general terms, it's a gentle re-working of the 450D. So you get the 15MP sensor much like the one that appears in the 50D, helping this to become the first entry-level DSLR to feature video (and 1080p HD video at that). You also get the lovely 920,000 dot VGA monitor that has been slowly working its way down most manufacturer's DSLR line-ups. There are a handful of other specification tweaks that come from the use of the latest Digic 4 processor but essentially this is most of a 50D stuffed into the familiar 450D body. 

And, if the loss of the letter 'X' from the US name seems a bit disconcerting, you can comfort yourself with the knowledge that the Japanese market will still know it by the odd-to-European-ears 'Kiss X3 Digital.' For simplicity's sake, we'll refer to the 500D/T1i/Kiss X3 by the name 500D throughout the rest of the preview. 

>Read more at dpreview.com
feature_bullets: New 15.1-megapixel CMOS sensor with DIGIC 4 Image Processor
Full HD video capture at 1920 x 1080 resolution; HDMI output
3.0-inch Clear View LCD; Live View Function for stills (Quick, Live and Face Detection AF modes) and video
Capture images and video to SD/SDHC memory cards (not included)
